syllabi_diff.change_summary: Assessed learning outcomes largely retained; NEW syllabus adds narrative context and guiding questions.
syllabi_diff.old_summary: Focuses on core lab skills and separation techniques without additional context.
syllabi_diff.new_summary: Adds non-assessed context and narrative around experimental planning and investigation aims.

syllabi_diff.change_summary: NEW syllabus expands mole concept applications to include concentration calculations in different units.
syllabi_diff.old_summary: Covers basic mole concept, empirical formula, limiting reagent, and concentration.
syllabi_diff.new_summary: Adds molarity variations and contextual calculations for real-lab scenarios.

syllabi_diff.change_summary: Learning outcomes for valence electrons, bonding types, and structure-properties link are no longer explicitly listed.
syllabi_diff.old_summary: Detailed coverage of ionic, covalent, and metallic bonding including particle models.
syllabi_diff.new_summary: Content appears absorbed under 'Structure & Properties of Matter' with no standalone bonding section.

syllabi_diff.change_summary: Introduces particle model explanations linking microstructure to observed physical/chemical properties.
syllabi_diff.old_summary: No equivalent standalone topic; aspects were scattered across bonding and states of matter.
syllabi_diff.new_summary: Consolidates bonding, molecular geometry, and material properties under a concept-driven model.

syllabi_diff.change_summary: Assessment scope adjusted: NEW syllabus removes specific industrial case studies (e.g., electroplating) and simplifies electrolytic cell descriptions.
syllabi_diff.old_summary: Includes industrial electrolysis applications, copper refining, and electroplating context.
syllabi_diff.new_summary: Focuses on core redox processes and decomposition reactions without industrial depth.
